name: Echoes of Home: Pop-Up Exhibit at Fort York
description:
Visit Fort York this summer and check out the new pop-up exhibit "Echoes of Home: Torontonians and their Struggles for Home". This pop-up installation explores the compelling stories and experiences of Toronto's diverse communities who have fought for their sense of home, belonging and identity during periods of conflict and peace. 

This installation is created in partnership with the Toronto Metropolitan University's Masters of Digital Media program.

name: In the Second-Floor Collage Gallery: "8+ by Eduard Zibnitski"
description:
In his first gallery exhibition collage and "assemblage" artist Eduard Zibnitski is showcasing eight of his works. Since then Curator Deborah Harris has added additional works by the artist, continuing into the adjacent Ascending Gallery.

Says Zibnitski about his work: "Never being completely serious, I feel fine with my art looking na√Øve, ugly or confusing; and too plain, or too rough sometimes too. But still, [a] feeling of mysterious presence is rather essential for me; it's what I try to achieve."

name: Marilyn Bell Park Disc Golf Course - Wednesday Night Glow League

location.name: Marilyn Bell Park Disc Golf Course

description:
Enjoy a glow-in-the-dark disc golf league, open to players of all skill levels. 

Fluorescent tape is provided for those who do not have glow-in-the-dark discs.

name: Cypher Playground Festival

location.name: The Theatre Centre, Franco Boni Theatre

description:
Honouring the city's street dance history, club culture, and underground spaces that fueled its evolution.

Opening night of this dance festival will start with a panel discussion on Toronto's club history and a film screening. Partake in a Hustle lesson and Disco/Funk Styles session hosted by Toronto Hustle Sessions, along with street dance battles, including Breaking, House, Punking/Whacking/Waacking, and Popping styles.

name: Hot Newfoundland Jazz with Duane Andrews
description:
Duane Andrews casts a wide net in the musical world. Uniting what would seem to be impossible, traditional Newfoundland music with the swing jazz of the legendary two fingered guitarist Django Reinhardt, Andrews makes it not just work, but soar. 

The Juno award winning composer, arranger, producer, conductor and globetrotting performer's latest album is the best evidence yet of his inimitable musical vision and is the sound of him, bringing it all back home. He'll be joined by the hottest swing band in the bay The Hot Club of Conception Bay which features Erin Power on vocals and mandolin and Isaac Andrews Power on fiddle and bass.
